Reviews.Title: “Overrated, but convenient for airport access.”
Reviews.Author: Chuck F
Reviews.Content: They rate as a 4 star hotel, but I don't think it really lives up to the billing. The rooms were comfortable and clean, but nothing special. Service was typical for a chain hotel in the upper prices, but nothing special at all. The fitness center was decently sized, but the equipment was outdated. There was a small pool and hottub as well. The high point of this hotel is the airport convenience. Connected to the A & E gates of Logan allow you to just walk on the skybridge to get in.

Reviews.Title: “Very Convenient for Pre-trip Stay”
Reviews.Author: sippican
Reviews.Content: For years we have used Best Western in Qunicy for our "stay, park & fly needs", however, recent shuttle issues (waiting over an hour) and lack of response from management led us to seek another property. We stayed at the Marriott for one night pre-flight, and left our car for the week. The hotel was easy to get to, rooms are comfortable and surprisingly quiet for location. We had dinner in the restaurant; the menu had nice selections and service was good. It was difficult to find a parking space and we left the car way out back. The lot was well-lit. There was quite a crowd for the Saturday early morning shuttles and they did fill up. Within ten minutes, we were dropped off at the terminal. Upon return, we called as directed and were picked up 15 minutes later. The shuttle did stop a number of times at various terminals taking about 15 minutes to return to the hotel.

Reviews.Title: “This one needs an upgrade”
Reviews.Author: 2dman
Reviews.Content: I have stayed at many Courtyards and this one in my opinion is the best candidate for a renovation. The service was OK and pleasant, but not quite as professional as I am accustomed to. The room was clean and fairly average with a good work desk. The walls were thinner than usual, as I could hear the couple in the next room with too much clarity. The restaurant needs particular attention. It is pretty dark and shabby looking. behind the bar their bottles consist of about 6 different liquors lined up in a row. Despite there being only about 6 people at the bar, I waited about 5 minutes before getting the bartender's attention. She was very busy talking with another waiter. The food I ordered there was actually pretty good. So all in all this was an average stay, but the hotel needs attention and the restaurant needs an upgrade and better hiring practices As other reviews have stated, it is located in an industrial area so there is not much in the area as alternatives for eating.

Reviews.Title: “quick layover”
Reviews.Author: Jake N
Reviews.Content: I had a seminar the next morning so instead of trying to avoid traffic going to boston in the morning, i decided to get there early and spent the night. Upon checking in, the staff was nice though I had to go through two different reps to get the room with a king bed vs. 2 queen beds. overall the room was very modern, small but enough for me to setup my work station and participate in several conference call. When i checkout in the morning, one of the rep refused to give me the receipt stating I booked through expedia so she can't give me anything and that i had to print it through expedia. Again, if i had talked to a different rep, i think it wouldn't be an issue. So word of advice, be weary of who you talk to as your result will vary.

Reviews.Title: “Comfort and Convenience”
Reviews.Author: tiggerm
Reviews.Content: This is the second time we have stayed here and did the Parking and Stay package before flying out of Logan. Arrived to hotel about 5pm and front desk agent was very pleasant. Dropped off our luggage in room and went back downstairs to the restaurant to grab a bite. The waiter was also very pleasant. We had a great meal. The room is very large for a airport hotel and bed was very comfy. We will be back again in May for our next trip..

Reviews.Title: “Great Location to park and fly”
Reviews.Author: Zabelle
Reviews.Content: This is the second time we have stayed here before flying out of Logan. The hotel is perfectly located and the room is very comfortable. The van operates 24 hours a day and we have never had a problem getting a ride. The one minor weakness is the menu in the restaurant. It is very limited and the food is just okay but I don't stay here for the restaurant, I stay for the parking. I highly recommend and will definatly use this hotel again.

Reviews.Title: “Airport convenience without compromise”
Reviews.Author: DropAnchor
Reviews.Content: Make no mistake about location - it is for airport Convenience - the area is industrial-ugly BUT the hotel is very nice and had everything I needed. The restaurant / bar staff was super super friendly even though the reception clerk told me there was no food because the restaurant was closed, he also DID NOT tell me there were prepared snacks available for purchase NOR did he tell me the bar was open. The bar waitress told me about the food that was tucked away in a corner of the reception area! Thank you dear lady you saved my night and you know who you are - we talked about our sons...

Reviews.Title: “Great place and location!”
Reviews.Author: Blaspdaley
Reviews.Content: I have stayed there quick a few times and the location is perfect. I have two kids in different colleges in Boston and this seems to be central to almost everything. Facilities are nice, clean and everyone is very helpful and friendly! Nice restaurant and bar! Shuttle to the airport. In fact, I usually drop my rent a car at the airport the night before I leave and then the shuttle will pick me up at the rent a car agency and give me a ride back to the hotel. This place is a winner!

Reviews.Title: “Clean and quiet hotel”
Reviews.Author: Dragons30
Reviews.Content: Great place to stay near the airport a little pricey for a courtyard but the service staff is great including the shuttle driver from the airport. Does have a bar and grill in the hotel which was nice not to go anywhere the night I arrived after a long day of traveling

Reviews.Title: “Excellent Hotel Near Airport”
Reviews.Author: hangdog
Reviews.Content: My family of 4 stayed here for 1 night before an early AM flight using their park and fly option. After reading some of the reviews I was a bit nervous, but this property met or exceeded all expectations. First of all, this property is a higher end Courtyard, closer to a full Marriott property. With a full service restaurant on site, we were able to check in, grab dinner and head to bed early. We had 2 rooms and both were clean and good sized. Shuttle service to and from the airport was great. No wait and a friendly shuttle driver. Great preflight hotel!

Reviews.Title: “so convenient!”
Reviews.Author: spontane0us_famly
Reviews.Content: so glad we decided to switch hotels for our 6am flight! the hotel has a great shuttle service to the airport, we're assured of getting there on time and it's actually very very convenient to the subway -- they have a shuttle that will pick you up from the subway station or it's really within an easy walking distance as well. it was so nice that we'll consider staying there instead of at a downtown boston hotel -- you get a whole lot more value and the convenience to the subway can't be beat.

Reviews.Title: “Convenient and pleasast”
Reviews.Author: 60plustraveller
Reviews.Content: We spent a night here in order to be close to the airport for a morning departure. The room was well appointed and comfortable. The hotel is not easy to approach from the North. It's important to have good directions. We left our car and took the airport shuttle to the transit station and had an easy ride to the center of Boston. The only food we tried was the complimentary coffee. It was worth what we paid for it.

Reviews.Title: “Not a glorious location, negative first impression, but better in the end”
Reviews.Author: kwa829
Reviews.Content: My first interaction with this hotel was negative . . . after a 6 PM arrival (hardly a strange time of day) I called to request the complimentary shuttle pick me up at Logan Airport and was told it would be about 15 minutes. After about 25 minutes of waiting at the correct pickup location, diligently watching for the van, still no shuttle so I called again (and the phone rang 15 times before someone answered) and was told it would be just another 5 minutes. Twelve minutes later, still no shuttle, so I called again . . . then at that point the shuttle finally showed up. Other comments: Pros: - Guest room and bathroom were spacious and clean - Complimentary 24-hour shuttle to/from airport and nearby â€œTâ€� (subway) station . . .used it 4 times and had a good experience 3 out of the 4 times (see above for the one bad experience). - Comfortable bedding; slept well - Impressive fitness center for a mid-tier hotel: high-end fitness equipment with individual TVs on each piece of equipment. Water, cups, and towels provided at the fitness center. - Friendly and efficient front desk staff . . . same for restaurant staff . . . I had forgotten my toothbrush and was cheerfully given a complimentary one. - Fresh cookies at the front desk during the evening - Spacious lobby good for meeting colleagues (e.g., to go over the presentation one last time), though some electrical outlets in the lobby would be nice. - Much more affordable than comparable lodging in downtown Boston . . . and really not too hard to get to/from downtown using the hotel's shuttle in concert with the â€œTâ€� (subway). Cons: - There is really nothing at all within walking distance of the property . . . the neighborhood is rental car lots, warehouses, and industrial facilities strung along an unwalkable busy highway. No restaurants, not even fast food, no convenience stores, no nothing. So if you donâ€™t have a rental car, you are kind of hostage to the hotel restaurant for your meals unless you want to go through the hassle of taking the (free) hotel shuttle to the T station and then riding the T to a more happeninâ€™ neighborhood. - Limited TV channel selection â€“ no MSNBC, no Comedy Central. - Breakfast buffet was lame and overpriced as is usually the case at mid-tier hotels. Iâ€™d love to have hotel restaurant profit margins. - Desk/ work area was kind of smallâ€™ not much space from front to back of desk (which was really just a counter up against the wall). - Common areas like hallways and elevator lobbies are looking worn. - Thereâ€™s a wee bit of airport noise, but insufficient to bother all but the most sensitive sleepers Neither pro nor con but potentially relevant - The hotel seems to be very popular with airline crews and in fact has a dedicated â€œcrew loungeâ€�

Reviews.Title: “Meets Marriott basic standards”
Reviews.Author: Miamifun_9
Reviews.Content: The hotel offers complimentary shuttle services which are very reliable. The lobby is nice and the business center is available at no charge. Every employee we meet is friendly and showed an honest desire to help, especially the housekeeping staff. One small drawback: do not forget anything in the room as the hotel does not have a good lost and found program. My friend lost a pair of shoes and when we called the hotel to claim them, the manager had gone home so no one else could help until the following day. We came the next day to retreive the shoes only to be told by the room attendant that her supervisor did not have time to look for them. Overall is a good hotel and despite the issue we experienced, I would recommed.

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel for our son's wedding”
Reviews.Author: CTYankee10
Reviews.Content: Our son chose this hotel to reserve a block of rooms for his wedding. It worked out great - very good service; upgraded rooms were designed and decorated very well; staff was very accommodating in arranging shuttles to the reception. On the downside, didn't have a complementary breakfast. Breakfast buffet was average, lunch was very good. Good location - convenient to East Boston where the wedding was, also to airport and Boston itself. Better than I expected for a Marriott courtyard

Reviews.Title: “expensive”
Reviews.Author: Shad70
Reviews.Content: I stayed one night in this hotel upon arrival from Europe. Close to the airport but far from the city center. The road (McClellan Highway) is very busy in mornings and evenings. This hotel has a convenient restaurant and a bar if you don't want to go outside. The room was comfortable with a fast Internet connection, but I found the price very expensive for that class of hotels but it was one of the only hotels available that week-end.

Reviews.Title: “Oh well ...”
Reviews.Author: MattSwitz
Reviews.Content: We stayed only for one night and had to get up at 3.30 am already. For those few hours the hotel was o.k. but we would not have wanted to stay much longer. We love Courtyard and Marriot but this hotel is by no means up to the usual standards of this particular chain. Rather worn furniture, rusty stuff in the bathroom and near the sink and the entire hotel felt in a very strange way damp. The shuttle to the airport was reliable and was also sent swift after our call to the hotel. Mind you, the operator answering the call was more than cool, should one write: unfriendly? A brisk question which terminal was meant and an o.k. and that was all. And last but not least the price was just horrific for a hotel in this state.

Reviews.Title: “Close to the airport with free shuttle and T access from the airport stop”
Reviews.Author: Kim_F_Maine
Reviews.Content: Easy to find, easy to and from the airport. Rooms were very comfortable, amenities also very good. Staff was friendly and helpful. Surrounding area was industrial, plan to eat at the hotel restaurant or take the shuttle to the airport T stop and go into Boston.

Reviews.Title: “close to airport”
Reviews.Author: luv-to-travel425
Reviews.Content: We stayed at this hotel because we had an early morning flight to Florida and they offered a free shuttle. The room was adequate and the beds were comfortable. I noticed they had a restaurant but we did not eat there. The shuttle service was prompt and I would recommend this hotel for anyone needing to stay in Boston pre/post a flight.

Reviews.Title: “great hotel with quick access to Logan and free shuttle to the T”
Reviews.Author: konadog1
Reviews.Content: This is my second visit this year. I tried out the exercise room and find they have a good number of treadmills and other machines so you don't have to wait. The restaurant is good, opening at 6am. The hotel is used by a lot of airline pilots and flight attendants and they have very responsive service. There were multiple folks at the desk on check-in and check-out, responding to requests very quickly.

Reviews.Title: “Quick stay, nothing fancy but no problems”
Reviews.Author: Craigypo
Reviews.Content: Had an overnight at this hotel, comfy, clean and quiet and only a 3 min ride on the shuttle to the airport. Mary the waitress in the bar was very nice and informative on how to get into the town for food etc. I thought that the place was good value for money.

Reviews.Title: “Very nice hotel, convenient to Logan Airport”
Reviews.Author: thecrazylizard
Reviews.Content: Very nice cosmopolitan hotel near Logan Airport. The hotel shuttle picked us up at the rental car location, then the next morning they took us to Logan. Very helpful loading and unloading luggage. We were on the 8th floor. Very quiet, clean, modern, comfortable beds. Plenty of tech conveniences. Very pleased with coffee bar, exercise room and laundry facility.

Reviews.Title: “Near the airport, nice Ramada”
Reviews.Author: timflies
Reviews.Content: I stay here regularly on business, This hotel is excellent,, Rooms are very clean and updated. The staff is friendly and helpfull The van runs constantly back and forth to the airport. The drivers are super friendly and always help with your bags. One slight drawback is that there are no restaurants within an easy walk from the hotel but at least they have a decent restaurant in the hotel itself.

Reviews.Title: “Convenient location for the airport”
Reviews.Author: gcmanke2
Reviews.Content: I spent 3 nights here in September 2011 Good: quick check-in, friendly service, great rooms, very clean, and very convenient to the airport. The shuttle bus is also very useful for a ride to & from the T (local subway) and the airport. If you are going downtown, this is the way to go! Not so good / ok: The in-house restaurant & bar leave a bit to be desired. I found the service to be indifferent & the food to be just barely edible. Not good: Driving downtown or anywhere besides the airport is an unholy nightmare - but this is more of a problem with Boston than the hotel. I hate driving in Boston with a flaming passion. Whoever designed the 93/95 interchange should be beaten on a daily basis and then forced to drive it every day for all eternity.

Reviews.Title: “Dark & Dreary”
Reviews.Author: Kaya11
Reviews.Content: I stayed here one night because of proximity to airport. I found the place to be dark and depressing. It is in a terrible area--an industrial park. I arrived late and had to park some distance from the entrance. I was actually nervous walking from my car! Again, everything in the hotel is dark. The lobby, the hallways, the rooms. Poor lighting everywhere. It was a real downer. They had done some updating of the furniture and fixtures in the room but you cannot miss the fact that everything here is worn out. Lastly, this hotel is terribly over-priced. I did have breakfast in the restaurant and that was fine. Individual TVs at the booths so you can watch the morning news, etc. The food selection was also fine and so was the service, but consistent with the rest of the place, it is just dark. Overall, I would not stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “Catered to the customers during Hurricane Irene”
Reviews.Author: VegasBigMouth
Reviews.Content: The Hotel was nice and clean and the front desk clerks allowed me to use the gym while my room was being prepared. Unfortunately I had to find an emergency flight and shorten my trip due to Hurricane Irene creeping up the coast. The Hotel manager, Michele and all the staff there were kind,caring, considerate and understanding of the circumstances and allowed me to check out late w/o a charge for an additional day stay. I appreciate the GREAT customer service.....THANKS AGAIN MICHELE.

Reviews.Title: “Does the job for a one night stay”
Reviews.Author: MrGelhs204
Reviews.Content: The good: comfortable beds, free parking; clean rooms, free wireless internet, free business center, good service (Thanks Joel), efficient Shuttle service to both Airport and T station (as well as local East Boston restaurants), easy to get via car, free coffee/tea around the clock, good location past Logan Airport. Starbucks nearby, but not much else within walking distance. The not exactly good: light sleepers will not like noise from busy highway, thin walls means you can hear the toilets flush a few rooms away, loud air conditioner fans; gym weight room broken, no pool. This is a perfect place for a one night stay, but there are better options for extended stays.

Reviews.Title: “Good functional hotel would use again”
Reviews.Author: GSAS
Reviews.Content: The hotels transport service is good, they will take you to the airport or more importantly the train station whenever you require it - this makes the city centre just a 20min trip away mostly. Staff were helpful and the bar\restaunt was decent food at an ok price, good selection for breakfast. If you get a room on the newer side the views to the Boston skyline are excellent.

Reviews.Title: “Not up to Marriott standards”
Reviews.Author: Stopover0816
Reviews.Content: This is an overpriced very mediocre property several minutes from Boston airport. As a Marriott elite member I chose this for a one-night stopover since it is the only Marriott hotel near the airport, but should have gone with one of the many Hiltons that are the monopoly in the Logan area. We chose a dinner included package for $50 more than the regular rate (at time of booking) after having read here that there is nothing else in the area and although $50 seemed like a premium price we did not want to go hunting after a long transatlantic flight. Everything was fine at check-in where they gave us our dinner voucher, but they failed to mention that the restaurant was effectively closed for renovations. What was offered instead was a sandwich and burger menu or a "buffet" of rewarmed leftovers served in the bar area. The buffet was tiny and to suggest that the food was rewarmed was generous since most of it was no better than room temperature. Even at full price the cost of the buffet for two would have been much less than the room rate difference. The room itself was small but adequate, but the hallways smelled damp and musty. I'm not sure this hotel can ever be improved to the current Courtyard standard and am surprised that Marriott continues to have their name on it. The only positive comment to add is that their internet service is good and reliable.

Reviews.Title: “Pleasantly surprised”
Reviews.Author: lawdogs1
Reviews.Content: Stayed here for one night before an early flight. This hotel, although a Courtyard, actually had the feel of a full service Marriott. Restaurant and full bar serving decent food and individual TV screens in each booth. Several computers with printers in the lobby for boarding passes. Airport shuttle for your use. Free parking if you have a car, which I did. The surrounding neighborhood is fairly bleak, the closest gas a couple moles up the road and not much else around. But the rooms were large, very clean and the staff were very pleasant. The airport is about a 5 minute drive away. Overall I was impressed with the amenities here and the decent room rate. I wouldn't want to stay here as a base for a Boston trip but it's an excellent choice for the late arrivers or early departers to Logan.

Reviews.Title: “Serviceable for its purpose”
Reviews.Author: br1524
Reviews.Content: The Courtyard by Marriott Boston Logan Airport is a former Holiday Inn property a few miles from the airport. The hotel has a couple of shuttles that run to/from the airport and the surrounding area. The hotel is located in an industrial-type neighborhood and there are no eating or shopping options nearby. This is your typical Courtyard; the hotel has been updated nicely from its previous Holiday Inn flag. I was disappointed my first night because the hotel restaurant was closed. The hotel provided a free continental breakfast the next morning as the restaurant was closed which was not anything great. The restaurant reopened the next day and I had the breakfast buffet. The food was OK, but the bottom of my buffet plate was quite dirty. The service from the staff was slow. The room was relatively quiet and clean. The room layout was somewhat awkward as the sink/vanity was positioned right behind the room door. The bed was not overly comfortable. The TV channel selection was somewhat limited and the TV did not work when I first checked in. Maintenance quickly came to the room and resolved the issue. This hotel is a decent choice if you are just in town for the night and need quick/easy access to the airport. However, after staying at several Courtyard properties in recent years, this one did not really impress me or stand out in any way.

Reviews.Title: “A pleasant surprise for an airport stay”
Reviews.Author: KenmareLisa
Reviews.Content: We were held over by Delta and put up in this hotel. I was pleasantly surprised at how nice it was. We had free shuttle service to and from the airport as well as to many restaraunts and even the T station. The staff upon arrival were very friendly even though they were faced with a plane loadfull of angry passengers. Our room was very spacious, clean and comfortable. On my receipt it stated this rooms value was 229.00. We had a king size bed with lovely linens and plenty of pillow. The bathroom was giant and incl all the usual soaps, shampoos, and body lotions. as well as being able to call down to the front desk for any other items we may need (toothpaste), free of charge. We also had FREE wifi with a very strong signal. This hotel is considerd an airport location and was a short shuttle ride as well as a short ride to the T station and in 2 stops, we were at Fanuel Hall Marketplace where there are hundreds of stores and restaraunts to browse for days! Ths is also located across the street from the Boston Aquarium and Harbor.

Reviews.Title: “give this marriott a miss,a 2star property at best”
Reviews.Author: darraghdublin
Reviews.Content: I recently stayed at this hotel with my family after arriving at boston logan from a transatlantic flight, As a marriott rewards member i expected the usual marriott standard, boy was i surprised, this hotel is set in an industrial park with some social housing to the rear.The hotel decor is from the 1970,s ,dingy and depressing, the rooms are small with a terrible colour scheme,The shower has no hot water, the toilet is accessed by way of a sliding door,When i arrived in the hotel at 5pm the restaurant was closed, later i went to see the restaurant when it was open again the colour scheme was awfull ,the bar reminded me of some seedy red light area.The hotel is mainly used by night stopping flight crews i feel very sorry for them they deserve better from there companies.Visitors to this hotel with famalies be carefull of the swimming pool featured in the hotels web page the pool has been out of commission for years and is covered with tarpolin which has now decayed over time .I will conpliment the staff on their friendliness and the bus driver is very helpfull, pity they work in such a property

Reviews.Title: “Good hotel and location very convenient and comfortable”
Reviews.Author: konadog1
Reviews.Content: I stayed here with my family and we had a nice room. I get upgraded usually to a bigger room due to Marriott Gold status, but I never seem to be upgraded when I'm travelling with my wife and two kids... Nonetheless it was a very nice hotel for the night. It takes some skill to navigate back and forth to Logan from the hotel, but it is possible.

Reviews.Title: “Convenient and Comfortable”
Reviews.Author: ksfmom
Reviews.Content: Although we were only here for a quick night's sleep before an early morning flight, this Courtyard property made quite an impression on us. We were en route from a long international flight, and in desperate need of a shower and a few hours sleep. It was a last minute decision to stay here rather than just hang out in the airport until our next flight, but I am so glad we did! Although the rate quoted was quite high, the reservations agent pointed out that I could use my Marriott reward points to pay for the room. This was SO worth it! As most travelers know, those properties close to airports in major cities are going to be expensive, so the initial price given was not unexpected. We found the shuttle to be very convenient and easily accessible. Front desk staff was friendly and professional...all in all, a very nice hotel that fit our needs perfectly.

Reviews.Title: “Loved the hotel”
Reviews.Author: tiggerm
Reviews.Content: Stayed just one night on one of the park and fly rates the night before a very early flight. Checked in and the front desk agent was very nice and very quick. Explained the shuttle service and gave me 2 free waters. We were hungry so we ate at the restaurant in the lobby and had a great meal. Went to bed pretty early due to the early flight, the beds were very comfy and slept great.. We will stay again on our next vacation,,

Reviews.Title: “Convenient for overnight stay but not pretty”
Reviews.Author: tgmystero
Reviews.Content: Found this hotel through Hotwire and got a very good price. However there's usually a reason why: we were checked in to the very last room ( although it did not feel like the hotel was full by any means) right at the top of the hotel, right at the end of the corridor which made us feel a bit second class with the stigma of getting the cheap seats. While naturally there's an element of jet -lag which makes things a bit uncomfortable, we felt the room was terrible in terms of getting a good nights sleep. For a hotel that's literally sited next to a busy freeway and very close to the airport, there didn't seem to be any soundproofing and consequently had a very poor night's sleep. We wouldn't say the views were pretty either looking over a very industrial part of the city so not a great introduction to Boston, but that's a matter of convenience over aesthetics.

Reviews.Title: “Inviting Lobby, Large Restaurant/Bar and Easy Shuttle”
Reviews.Author: TheRoamingGnomette
Reviews.Content: This hotel was perfect for a quick business trip. The lobby is large but warm, with convenient airline ticket printing stations and a nice complimentary coffee/tea station. The rooms are decent size; the bathroom counter space was phenomenal! There is a fair bit of outside noise, but overall it was a very pleasant stay.

Reviews.Title: “Very nice stay”
Reviews.Author: mvtraveler46
Reviews.Content: This hotel used to be a Holiday Inn, we were very surprised and delighted when we checked in. Everyone was very friendly, warm cookies at check in counter, free hot coffee in the lobby, and the fireplace was very soothing to sit by. The rooms were very clean, and the food in the restaurant was great. The staff even put the football game on tv for us. It is a little ways from the airport, but you don't usually have to wait long. I am very picky about my hotel rooms, but will certainly stay again.

Reviews.Title: “unacceptable”
Reviews.Author: bkd_23
Reviews.Content: As a airline professional I stay in hotels approximately 14-16 nights a months. This hotel ranks as one of my top 2 worst stays. Problem #1 the air conditioner ran constantly and sounded as if were going to explode. When turned off fan continued to run and blow cold air. Problem #2 room was literally about 60-70 yards from a main road. All in all I slept maybe 2 hours. Problem #3 when I called the front desk manager was gone. When I finally reached him he was sorry and said he would move my room. Great but it was 1:30 am and i was leaving at 4:30 am. Staff was unprofessional and unhelpful. The other crew member said he had no hot water and had to move rooms. Overall poor hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Best for the $$ for Logan airport travel”
Reviews.Author: richmwagner
Reviews.Content: I recently used the stay/park/fly package of the Hampton Inn, also just north of Logan airport. I'm now doing the same thing, but am staying at the Courtyard Marriott. I'm much happier at the Marriott. For instance: Nice restaurant in the hotel, saves me a trip finding a local place. Hotel is - overall - roomier, "home-ier" and more comfortable. Great room: new, modern, very attractive decor, spacious, very good internet connectivity (all better than Hampton Inn). At check-in, there was a confusion about my having the stay/park/fly package (I booked via the internet), but the front desk was very helpful: without my making a fuss, she volunteered to ask her manager to change to the (better priced) package, and the change was done in less than an hour. Maybe a bit more money than the Hampton, but not nearly enough to make me want to go there again. Courtyard Marriott is clearly better for the money.

Reviews.Title: “Watch the prices in the Market!”
Reviews.Author: txrus
Reviews.Content: Like another poster, made a 1 stopover during a 5 city swing. Room was quite comfy w/plenty of plugs easily accessible at the desk for cellphone, laptop, etc. Plenty of counter space in the bathroom for 'stuff''. Bed nice & comfy, as well. One word of warning if you are desperate & tempted to buy a munchy or snack from the hotel 'Marketplace'-watch the prices! What comes up on the scanner @ checkout may be significantly higher than the posted price.

Reviews.Title: “Decent lounge, good wifi, but ordinary food.”
Reviews.Author: Ghanshyam_51
Reviews.Content: We were booked by Continental Airlines for overnight stay on 15th November. The checkin process was fast, and we were given our room key within 3 minutes. The room was functional & comfortable, meant primarily for overnight travelers. The breakfast was ordinary and so was the menu for food. We avoided taking lunch as there was hardly any choice for vegetarians. Avoid it if you are a vegetarian.

Reviews.Title: “Good overnight stop”
Reviews.Author: mabbsy
Reviews.Content: Stayed here for one night at beginning and end of our recent US visit and have no complaints. Shuttle was quick and convenient, even at ridiculous hours of the morning and hotel had everything we required. Only slight complaint was that the bedroom walls were a bit thin and I think the guy in the next room was having a nightmare.

Reviews.Title: “Comfortable and convenient to airport”
Reviews.Author: SanDiegoBusyWoman
Reviews.Content: I stayed here for one night prior to an early morning flight out of Boston. The room was very comfortable and seemed updated. Check in and check out were courteous and prompt. The most significant positive of the hotel is that it provided 24-hour shuttle service at what they say is every 15 minutes. This made getting to the airport for an early morning flight much easier than I have found it at most airport hotels where often shuttles don't start until 6 am. I had no trouble getting to the airport at 4:30 am. I did have a little trouble with the shuttle from the airport to the hotel -- the airport was unusually congested with Columbus Day weekend traffic on a Friday and I had to wait about 45 minutes (once the shuttle drove right by me waving and, as a tall female, I generally am hard to miss.) The restaurant (and I don't think I have been to a Courtyard before that that had one) had a reasonable but not large selection of items and I enjoyed dinner very much. It was also not too expensive for most items. The location of the hotel is far from everything but the rental cars and I saw no other alternatives to eating at the hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Must have been recently refurbished”
Reviews.Author: BrentBDallas
Reviews.Content: We stayed here to be close to Logan airport for an early flight. We used Marriot points for the room, which was easy to book, and they gave us a very nice room. The room looked brand new and has a very nice, modern design. The lobby and restaurant also looked like they had been recently updated. Yes, this Courtyard has a full service restaurant and bar. The staffs in the restaurant, and reception, were very nice and the food was excellent. The web site read like there is no airport shuttle, but it runs every 15 minutes 7x24. We drove to the hotel, and it was very easy to find with a driveway right onto 1A (did not have to look for an exit). This is a top of the line Marriott Courtyard.

Reviews.Title: “An comfortable, accommodating, reasonably priced experience.”
Reviews.Author: BUBOUND
Reviews.Content: We stayed one night and we arrived earlier than check-in. We were given our room immediately. We were pleased with the room, the comfort of the bed and pillows, and the shuttle service to and from the airport and train. We never had to wait more than 20 minutes to be picked up by the shuttle when we called for it. Make sure you have the hotel number and call as soon as you land to get picked up at the airport or the train station. We were able to leave our luggage in a room behind the check-in desk when we checked out and came back for it when we were ready to head to the airport.

Reviews.Title: “Clean and close to the airport.”
Reviews.Author: jray123
Reviews.Content: Clean hotel with fresh baked cookies on arrival. Book on the front of the hotel to have a view of the river -- was able to see tug boats from our hotel room. Offers a shuttle service to and from airport as well as the subway.

Reviews.Title: “Good choice close to airport”
Reviews.Author: gregc1982
Reviews.Content: Check in was quick and efficient, rooms were well appointed and surprisingly quiet for an airport area hotel. Shuttle provided easy access to airport and the T subway station. On site restaurant was better than most Courtyard restaurants I've tried. Would stay again.

Reviews.Title: “Comfortable affordable if you can't do downtown.”
Reviews.Author: chriskre
Reviews.Content: Stayed here on my points and booked 2 cash rooms. This hotel is not a typical courtyard. It's a high rise. They have an airport shuttle which I did not use since I was driving and they have free parking. The location was convenient to downtown if you can't afford the pricey downtown hotels. Still paid $200 a night but this is Boston and so it goes. The hotel is not in the greatest neighborhood but I guess typical for an airport hotel. The hotel has a buffet breakfast but not enough wait staff when the hotel is busy in the morning. Buffet ran out of a few things and it took a while to replenish but the food was good and the fruit nice and sweet despite the slow service. The hotel staff is friendly. The rooms were clean except for one of our rooms which was not made up when we checked in. Obviously this was a mistake but since we were going out to dinner we gave them time to make up the room. I think they should have comped us breakfast for the inconvenience but nothing was offered. We checked in at 5pm so really no excuse for not having the room ready. Overall we enjoyed our stay and would consider it again if I couldn't find something reasonable downtown.

Reviews.Title: “Great Location”
Reviews.Author: Jimdo
Reviews.Content: After attending a reunion in Groton, Ct, the wife & I decided to see Boston for a couple days before flying back home. We chose the Courtyard Boston as we had to catch an early flight out and I didn't need the hassle of trying to find my way to the airport in morning rush hour traffic. The hotel has a shuttle, sometimes I saw two running, that will take you to the airport and the subway station at the airport. We found this very convenient getting into Boston to see the sights. You relly don't want a car for Boston, unless you're going outside the city. When we returned in the evening, a call to the hotel brought the shuttle in minutes, and they always had apple pie w/ ice cream in the lobby. I've read other comments that the rooms are small, but we were gone most of the time. They might be smaller than some Courtyards, but they were OK for us. As far as cleanliness, they were typical Courtyard - excellant!

Reviews.Title: “Never Again!!”
Reviews.Author: Disneyfan95
Reviews.Content: This was our second visit to this hotel. We stayed for one night because we had an early flight the next morning out of Logan Airport. Upon entering our room, we noticed that the water in the toilet was a yellow/brown color. Not sure what to make of it, though it left us feeling that the room was not clean. The worst part of the visit, was that the air conditioner was EXTREMELY loud and woke us up every time it went on and off, which was about every 15 minutes. We actually jumped every time it went on, that's how loud it was. We were exhausted by the time we had to get up at 6:00am for our flight. NEVER AGAIN!!

Reviews.Title: “Reasonably Priced For Boston”
Reviews.Author: StealthySteven
Reviews.Content: I stayed here because most Boston hotels were too expensive for my budget. It was just about what I expected from a Marriott Courtyard. Nice clean rooms, lobby, etc. You really need a car if you want to stay here and eat or drink anywhere outside the hotel. The nearest liquor store (or anything else) was about a mile away. It is possible to take the hotel shuttle back and forth from the airport where you can catch a subway into the city, but I wouldn't do that at night.

Reviews.Title: “A convenient Boston hotel”
Reviews.Author: plktraveler
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Marriott Courtyard Logan since we were to do some touring in Boston, then drive a rental car north to Maine. We were pleased with the accomodating shuttle service to and from the airport, local restaurants and the nearby transit stop. We rarely waited more than a few moments and the shuttle was quick and sure. It was easy to use the shuttle and the "T" to go into Boston for dinner or other reason. Room and meal service were fully satisfactory and service in general was efficient. We did the same thing on our trip home, using the shuttle for a 6am plane with the same efficiency.

Reviews.Title: “Staff is terrible; best avoided”
Reviews.Author: teb777
Reviews.Content: After many stays at this hotel and trying to stay here as a Marriot rewards member I can't take it anymore. I find the staff to be completely clueless and managers and sales to be arrogant and incompetent. Much better and more cost effective options in area including Sheraton, Embassy Suites, Holiday Inn, Hampton Inn, etc.

Reviews.Title: “Park Here, Fly There Package was Perfect!”
Reviews.Author: lduv
Reviews.Content: We were flying out of Boston on a weekday morning and knew the traffic from the South Shore to the airport would be awful, so we booked this package for the night before our flight. Everything worked perfectly! We drove there at about 7 o'clock at night, and had no problems finding it. We told the gentleman at the desk what time we wanted to be at the airport, and he told us to be in the lobby 15 min. before that for the shuttle. The room was beautiful and very comfortable. We went to the lobby in the morning and jumped right on a shuttle. The best part is that from their location, they don't (or at least we didn't) get stuck in any traffic going to the airport. They dropped us off at our airline and we were on our way! When we came home it was a little tricky finding the right Marriott on the courtesy phone board, but as long as you remember the address, you're all set. The shuttle came within 10-15 minutes after our call and we were brought back to our waiting car. I would use this hotel again if we are flying early out of Boston, no question!

Reviews.Title: “Close to the airport, but not much around it”
Reviews.Author: chguy
Reviews.Content: This hotel is great if you want something near the airport. If you do not have a car, there is nothing around as fas as store, restaurant. But if you want to catch a flight or have business in East Boston, this is a great location. The hotel itself is rather typical for a courtyard. Good bedding, room not too large, but decent. there is a restaurant on site, but I have not eaten there. It looks like typical hotel food. The service was courteous and efficient. On the perks side, It has a decent size swimming pool and a small fitness room.

Reviews.Title: “Ten days in, this is the worst hotel”
Reviews.Author: Apolizzi
Reviews.Content: We have been on the road for ten days and this hotel is the poorest we have stayed. There is no fridge, the rooms are tiny, we had to ask for extra bedding (none in the closet) and the lobby lacks AC and is stuffy & hot. The shuttle driver flaked out and did not pick us up from the rental car place, although he drove on by!

Reviews.Title: “Convenient for early airport departure”
Reviews.Author: CAFamilyRvwr
Reviews.Content: We stayed here because of an early airport departure the next day. This is a reasonable value for an airport property and had nice furnishings. The shuttle to the airport was responsive and convenient. We found it a little tricky to find the hotel on our own. I can't say that we stayed in this hotel very long, but our stay was fine.

Reviews.Title: “The cleanest hotel room I've ever stayed in.”
Reviews.Author: bacalao_ma
Reviews.Content: The room was immaculate. They have a bar that serves food but not a full fledge restaurant. AC a little noisy. What caught our attention was the cleanliness of the rooms.

Reviews.Title: “Passing Through. Was Perfect.”
Reviews.Author: Tiflis
Reviews.Content: Admittedly, I prefer Marriotts. I had not stayed here previously but had an overnight enroute Europe and thought I would try it rather than going downtown for the cozy stuff. I am really glad that I did. Rooms were A1. Restaurant was superb and reasonable. While Marriott is non-smoking, the Courtyard had several areas outside that were easy to access. And the staff was marvelous. In every respect. Highly recommended!

Reviews.Title: “URBAN CONVENIENCE AND COMFORT”
Reviews.Author: Hoosiergadabout
Reviews.Content: Two important lodging accommodation considerations when visiting large cities are location and expense. The overall cost of lodging is more readily factored in to travel plans. Location, however, can be something of a wild card affecting a overall travel budget in unexpectedly kind and not-so-kind ways. If easy access to the many attractions which a city provides is high on the priority list, one shouldnâ€™t overlook the fact that there are many ways to get to â€œwhere the action isâ€� in the same amount of time. The best or most efficient route is not always from the urban core. Reasonably priced accommodations which might be slightly off the beaten path are sometimes overlooked in an effort to be in the heart of a city. And that would be true when planning a trip to Boston. What â€œreasonably pricedâ€� means will vary of course from traveler to traveler. For cost-conscious leisure travelers, this notion could mean relishing a hostel experience; staying at the YMCA; putting up with some minor annoyances and a lack of amenities in quaint, unique or boutique lodging offerings which often dot a city; or even staying at a 3 star hotel as opposed to a 4 star facility. When considering the vast range of lodging options available in Boston, it is definitely wise to scrutinize on-line traveler reviews and a street map alike for lodging possibilities. Marriott is a nationally recognized reputable hotel chain, and it operates hotels in several different Boston locations. Rates for these hotels are consistent with the level of services expected of higher-end hostelries. However, budget-minded travelers who are nevertheless willing to pay a few dollars above the discount rate structure for overnight lodging but not face post-travel bankruptcy proceedings following stays at such star-spangled hotels, one might consider the Marriott Courtyard at Logan Airport located approximately 1 mile north of Boston. The Marriott Courtyard doesnâ€™t boast a tony in-city brass door knocker neighborhood address but is instead situated in the urban environs of Boston. What it does have going for it is excellent access to the airport and to Boston via the transit (the â€œTâ€�) train station. Such convenience is arguably well worth the extra dollars spent to stay at the Courtyard. The hotel runs a 24 hour call-request shuttle bus from the hotel to both the airport and the train station. Once deplaned and with baggage claimed, simply call the hotel to request a pickup. The hotelâ€™s shuttle bus will pick hotel guests up at the designated traffic island outside Loganâ€™s baggage claim area promptly. Wait times rarely exceed 15 minutes. The drivers are courteous and will assist passengers with loading and unloading baggage onto and from the vehicle. The same service is extended to guests wishing to be picked up at the train station after a day spent exploring the city. A $1 per bag tip to the driver is not excessive and an appreciated gesture. The drivers definitely earn any such gratuities considering their punctuality, pleasant demeanor, assistance with luggage and ease in navigating the busy traffic flow of both highway and the airport. The complimentary shuttle bus ride takes generally about five minutes from hotel to airport or train station depending on the volume of passengers. And, when considering the stress that early morning departure flights from Logan Airport can sometimes cause, there is much to be said for the peace of mind which arises from taking the shuttle bus from the Courtyard. Hop aboard with fellows travelers, business folks, and airline pilots and flight attendants and leave the driving to the hotel. The Mariott Courtyard is a nearly 250 room twelve storied hotel. The facility has been nicely upgraded from past hotel ownership. Most rooms have commanding cityscape views of Boston, harbor communities, and the urban areas adjacent to the hotel. The lobby is spacious and attractively decorated and appointed. Facilities on the first floor include the registration desk manned by courteous and professional staff, a full service restaurant and lounge, reception area chairs and sofas, and a business work area outfitted with wired workstations, wireless internet service, and fax and printer. Located near the elevators are a complimentary coffee and tea beverage station, a bank of monitors to assist with airport boarding passes and an ATM cash dispensing machine. Glass front coolers with beverages and snacks for purchase are located steps away from the front desk. My guest room featured two clean and comfortable Queen-sized beds, a well illuminated desk with combination bureau drawers, closet (armoire) space, a wide panel remote controlled television, and wireless access for computer lap-toppers. The bathroom while not overly large was nevertheless bright, clean, decorated in a neutral color palette, stocked daily with an ample supply of towels, and included a toilet and tub-shower combination with excellent water pressure and quick response temperature control. A well-lit mirror sink area with the requisite complimentary toiletries (soap, shampoo etc.) faced the bathroom. Electrical appliances included a hair dryer and coffee-pot setup within armâ€™s reach of the sink area. The room provided no basis for complaint at all during my four nights stay. On the first night I was aware of flights taking off and landing at Loganâ€™s distant runways which were visible from the roomâ€™s windows, but that to-be-expected airport noise signature quickly disappeared into the background from the second night onward. Even the sound of elevators in transit based on my room's close proximity to the elevator foyer also dissipated from awareness. The lobby level houses a restaurant and lounge which was a spacious, nicely designed setting offering a breakfast, lunch and dinner menu. A menu board for the various meals and dining times was positioned at the head of the stairs and carpeted ramp leading to the restaurant area. Prices were not cheap but were commensurate with other better Boston restaurants. The only meal which I ate at the hotel during my stay was the well-tended breakfast buffet. The buffet items were varied, attractively presented and very tasty. Although the cost for the buffet was more than I am accustomed to spending for breakfast in the midwest, the ease of starting the day off with a leisurely hearty breakfast right within the hotel was in my estimation well worth the additional expense. Wait staff were attentive and courteous. Most of the comfortable booths seemed to have individual wall-mounted, remote controlled TVâ€™s for the convenience of diners. There is an outdoor pool on the hotel grounds but it was open for use during my visit. If convenience in accessing Bostonâ€™s many attractions and reasonably priced comfort are high on your travel agenda, then the Courtyard Marriott at Logan Airport is a very sensible option to consider when making plans to visit one of New Englandâ€™s must-see destinations. Robert from Indiana "Hoosiergadabout" Dates of stay: May 27-31, 2010

Reviews.Title: “Convenient and a little confusing”
Reviews.Author: DownSouthUS
Reviews.Content: Remodeled Holiday Inn near Logan Airport is nice. The new rooms and lobby design make it up to date. IF you are driving as I was, it is confusing to get there. The sign to turn left coming into Boston is about a block before the hotel-- very easy to miss. Shuttle service to airport is frequent but beware you have to call from inside the Delta terminal before going across the street to the pickup space on arrival. Ice machine on 11th floor didn't work and no indication it had worked recently. Disappointed the rooms have flat screen tvs but no HD signals; therefore the signal is poor quality. Recommendation to stay here for airport travel at lower rates than the properties on the airport grounds. No big disappointments. .and fresh chocolate chip cookies appeared during the late afternoon at the front desk. . mmmm good!!!

Reviews.Title: “Comfortable, clean, nice staff but isolated location and perks need improvement”
Reviews.Author: Redwood8
Reviews.Content: My wife and I stayed Friday through Sunday and while the stay was clean and comfortable with accommodating and friendly staff. However be prepared for the fact that you are not in walking distance from any convenience store, fast food, restaurant, or shopping of any kind. Also, the restaurant menu for breakfast was relatively poor and expensive, definitely not worth the expense and the hotel management should work on improving this. The breakfast buffet wasn't much better that is found in lower rated hotels. Free shuttle service is available to the airport, which was generally good.

Reviews.Title: “Awsome”
Reviews.Author: shellykishun
Reviews.Content: this is one of the best hotels I've stayed at, very clean, loved the pool and hot tub, my kids had a blast, breakfast was AWSOME, even though I had to pay for mine (kids eat free), so worth it!

Reviews.Title: “A Bit Dated, But OK”
Reviews.Author: cinncitraveler
Reviews.Content: Certainly not the best Courtyard, especially at the rate they are charging, but it was okay. Everything is a bit dated, and feels like the 70s. The staff at the front desk is not particularly warm or welcoming, but the staff at the bar and restaurant were much better. The room was spacious and did seem clean. The bed was newer and comfortable. I liked the in-room coffee and free wireless. It is convenient to the airport and has a free shuttle. If things were a bit more updated, I might give it a 4.

Reviews.Title: “OK...but here is the real deal”
Reviews.Author: imreading
Reviews.Content: Just was there last week. Restaurant was closed for renovation (they said a pipe burst) Even the bar area was relocated to an uncomfortable section, so this must have been a disaster in the kitchen. TV offers no pay per view, just very few basic cable choices you cannot walk to any local restaurants or stores, so had to rely on local shuttle, which was nevertheless very accommodating. OK workout area. Excellent beds as described before, but bathroom is very basic. Not really up to the Courtyard standards I have seen in my experiences. Someone said this was a Holiday Inn in the past which would make sense. Overall just OK, not my choice of hotel. Probably good for 1 night. Unfortunately I was there longer. Even wireless Internet was flaky at best on my floor

Reviews.Title: “Good choice for a quick overnight stay when flying out”
Reviews.Author: travelmeMaine
Reviews.Content: This hotel was nice and met our needs when flying out the next day from Logan. I can't say I would stay here for anything more than a night or two as it is in a good location for Logan but not for anything else. Parking was great as we did the park and fly option. Room was clean and crisp and everything was in order. This hotel is easy to miss so make sure you have good driving directions. We actually drove past it and ended up heading right into Logan. This can be a high stress/high traffic situation. We made a quick turn around were able to get back on track . Check in was helpful and very friendly. Shuttle departs anytime you wish and with a quick call they will pick you up when you arrive back at the airport. You can save a ton of money staying here. The Hilton at Logan wanted $334.00 per night for their park and fly option with 7 days of parking. This hotel wanted $149.00 with free parking for 10days. The shuttle gets you there in about 15-20 minutes. Well worth the savings and I would stay her again.

Reviews.Title: “Nice hotel, hard to drive to”
Reviews.Author: ziggyziggy
Reviews.Content: The hotel looks avergae on the outside but the rooms inside are nice and modern. I am not too crazy about the sliding door of the bathroom because it does not block noise at all but the entire room looks nice with flat panel LCD TVs and comfortable beds. As for the location, it is horrible. The highway that its situated on is one of thw worst Ive driven on. Just trying to get from one side of the highway to the other takes lots of turns. If you miss an exit, keep on driving down the road and you will see roundabouts and intersections that boggle the mind. There is no logical explanation as to why the streets in that neighborhood are designed the way they are. I tried heading to a nearby Wendy's for dinner and i had to drive through roundabouts, roads meant for horses, and risked everything when driving thru intersections as i have no idea who has the right of way. As for the hotel, its good, location, exactly the opposite.

Reviews.Title: “Nice Redo!”
Reviews.Author: soccerknut
Reviews.Content: I had been to this property when it was a Holiday Inn. They did a nice job on the conversion to a marriott. I found everyone helpful and friendly. Shuttle service was prompt and quick. This is a definite hotel to recommend!

Reviews.Title: “Excellent Business Hotel near logan”
Reviews.Author: ZP83
Reviews.Content: I stayed here to help launch the Boston station for Virgin America for a week. and for training in Feb of '09 I did not in my 5 days have a bad experience. The rooms were very clean and the staff was always willing to help you no matter if it was 10PM or 3AM. The only draw back was the location of this hotel. There is really not much to do here except meet for conferences and be close to logan. The shuttle drivers I encountered were extremely nice and help everyone with their bags with a friendly attitude. The rooms were nice and spacious as I can remember and at a reasonable price. The food was what I expected from a marriot the simpler the better which is what I always did. So there are no complaints about the food from the restaurant. It was a good stay overall and had lots of fun mingling with my other teammates from other stations in the Virgin America System. Solid Hotel!

Reviews.Title: “Met Expectations - seemed like a good value”
Reviews.Author: aolguy
Reviews.Content: Stayed here after missing my flight out of Logan. It's about a mile and a half away from the airport but they provide frequent free shuttle service. Pretty typical airport hotel, was clean and the rooms were good sized. The bed was quite large with nice linens. I will agree with a previous review that the a/c/heater was VERY loud. There is a restaurant but no room service which was disappointing as I was tired and wanted to eat in my room. But the restaurant has a large bar seating area and the staff was extremely friendly so I enjoyed my meal from the bar watching a couple of football games on the large screen and chatting with the staff and few other lodgers.

Reviews.Title: “Wow! This is not your average Courtyard”
Reviews.Author: bogdan117
Reviews.Content: It looks average on the exterior, but from the lobby you know this is not your average Courtyard. Soaring spaces with modern decor. Large full bar with restaurant with a very lounge like feel. The rooms were the size you expect in a Courtyard, but the style and finishes were very fresh and modern. Wonderful surprise.

Reviews.Title: “Hard to find, stay ok”
Reviews.Author: ewoksmommy
Reviews.Content: If it weren't for the airport shuttle, I doubt we would have found it very easily. Shuttle was very nice. It took us to the subway for travel to various areas of the city.Nothing was around hotel since it was right by airport. Parking was complimentary. We had Breakfast for Two vouchers. We STILL received a bill for taxes AND a tip that was ALREADY included for over $12!! Crazy! We ate the Buffett. We saw the waitress twice (once for a drink order and again to receive that drink order). They charged us $12 per child for a buffet and the kids had cereal and juice. The room we were offered was right by the lobby and the front desk. The room was noisy due to the location. We should have switched, but it was late and the kids needed to go to bed. The walls were thin enough to hear what "fun" another couple was having next door! Yikes! If you are traveling for business or need in and out service to BOS then I would recommend it. Easy boarding pass access with computers in lobby. Coffee and tea available in lobby.

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful Customer Service!”
Reviews.Author: wildlife_girl
Reviews.Content: We stayed here one night before flying out of Boston Logan. I gave it a high score on location because we were trying to find a hotel that was nice and convenient to the airport because we had an early flight. I stay in Marriott Hotels fairly consistently due to work travel. This was one of the best ones I've been to. The customer service is outstanding, rooms are very nice, very clean and they have a bar and restaurant which is very convenient for the airport folks who don't want to deal with the traffic and congestion of Boston. They apparently have a couple of good restaurants nearby as well and the hotel shuttle will take you there. It has free parking if you have a car but they have free shuttle service to and from the airport. We actually ditched our rental car and had the shuttle pick us up so we could save a day on the car rental. The only ding I would give the hotel was the internet connection. Slow and inconsistent. I'm not sure if they have enough wireless routers to satisfy all the rooms.

Reviews.Title: “Lovely rooms but had about 2 hours sleep”
Reviews.Author: ldale330
Reviews.Content: We needed a room for the night prior to flying out of the USA. We were offered a room for approx 230 us dollars. The room was lovely and really clean. All was fine until we went to sleep. Unbeknown to us they had placed us knowingly in a room right by the lift shaft. Every 15 minutes an alarm went off and woke both me and my partner off. It was the night from hell. I was so knackered in the morning. We both thought it was the horn from a ship, but on waking realised that it was some sort of alarm from the lift shaft. My partner complained and he was offered a refund of $40.00 which he refused. He left early in the morning and at 7am I finally nodded off to sleep only to be woken again at 7.30am by housekeeping. I wanted to cry. I went for breakfast and it was not briliant especially when they charged me $15.00. When I booked in I was lead to believe that breakfast was included in the price. Also at check in we were not told where our rooms were, which floor they were on, nor were we offered assistance with our bags.

Reviews.Title: “Dark & noisy”
Reviews.Author: drbubba1995
Reviews.Content: Stayed here the night before my flight. The a/c was unbelievably noisy. The sink was behind the door as you entered the room and had horrible lighting. The coffee pot was filthy. The hallways were dark and the woodwork scuffed. Absolutely nothing about this place said Marriott. I stayed at another Marriott for a couple of days before this one and it was the difference between day and night. Never again would I stay here as I could have made my flight in plenty of time from just about anywhere in the City of Boston.

Reviews.Title: “Great "Park & Dine" package if you're a Marriott Member! Up to 10 days of free parking plus airport shuttle service!”
Reviews.Author: Karascorner
Reviews.Content: We (my boyfriend and I of 7yrs) stayed here in room #730 only one night, August 26-27th 2009, after flying home late on August 26th to Boston from a 5 night stay on Grand Bahama Island. Since our return flight was coming in late at night, we figured we'd stay here one night before driving home to Connecticut the following day. As a Marriott Member, I booked the "Park & Dine" package which got us our room for the night plus 10 days of free parking and a $50 food and beverage credit to the on site Bistro restaurant for a total of $201.29 after taxes and fees. Which is a decent bargain given that just 6 days of parking alone would have cost us around $90 with other vendors, not to mention the added $50 food credit, so we figured our one night really only cost us $61.29 (but we earnt points on the full rate, whereas if the parking and food was done separately we would not have received points on those!). POSITIVES: Parking at the hotel was free during our stay and free while we were in the Bahamas, BUT that was ONLY because it was an included perk for using the promo code I did when I booked our stay. Otherwise, parking would have been a $14 a day (while we were not a guest there) but it's free for the nights that you do stay there. The parking lot is patrolled by security. We saw the security vehicle making its route around the parking lot while we waited for the airport shuttle to arrive. The staff for the airport shuttle (the shuttle service is free!) was very friendly and pretty much on-time whenever we were quoted waiting times. When we needed to be picked up, all I did was call the front desk and tell them what airway we were flying and then from there we waited by the green marked section at the airport to flag down the driver. I should note that their white shuttle van is clearly marked with the "Courtyard" logo with "Logan Airport" underneath so you know you're getting into the right shuttle (see my photo). The hotel has a mini-market on the main floor with a decent variety of personal care products and food products like sandwiches, frozen dinners, ice cream, cookies, crackers, etc... Just be aware that convenience comes with a price. The woman who checked us in on August 26th was very friendly--although I did have to remind her about the $50 food credit we were supposed to receive as part of our package. The bathroom was clean and somewhat larger than other Courtyard's we have stayed at. The sink was actually in the bathroom, not outside of it and there was a large amount of counter space. The shower head was adjustable so that you could change the type of spray and whether it was high or low pressure. It also took little to no time at all for the water to heat up. There was a decent size flat screen LCD TV in the room. There were blackout curtains as well as window sheers. I've stayed at other places that didn't have black-out curtains and to me these are a necessity. I need darkness when I sleep, so if I get woken up by the slightest noise in the morning I need to know that the sun won't keep me from falling back asleep. Noise? None really. I didn't hear any planes the whole night and the only thing I did hear was the thermostat whirring as our room was not near an ice machine or elevator. The food at the Bistro restaurant for lunch was decent and the waitress was friendly. To use up our $50 credit we both got the full rack of baby back ribs and some drinks. The ribs were tasty even though they weren't slathered with BBQ sauce like I normally prefer. Its location is very convenient to the highway. It's right outside the hotel. We were lucky to miss a lot of the traffic caused by Ted Kennedy's death and the service going on in Boston August 27th while we were headed home. NEGATIVES: We arrived at about 3am the morning on August 21, 2009 to use our parking credit prior to our stay and use the complimentary airport shuttle to bring us to the airport. The guy at the front desk seemed very confused about the package we had booked and didn't understand that we were flying first, and then staying. After about 15 minutes of confusion on his part, we were finally waiting 15 minutes again for the airport shuttle to pick us up. Surely we could not have been the first people to use an airport parking package offered at this hotel, as there were plenty of cars in the lot with parking passes hanging from the rear-view mirrors when we arrived. I'm a member of Marriott Rewards and only one of my requests was fulfilled (which was a high floor). I requested extra foam pillows, there were none. The refrigerator? Non existent, there wasn't one in the room. The extra towels? We only received 1 extra. The hotel mini-market, again, even though I mentioned some of it as a positive. There was no price list posted that I could see for the food items. As I mentioned before, convenience does come with a price... just 2 ice cream Drumsticks and a Tollhouse cookie ice cream sandwich cost us about $15! The in-room temperature control unit was pretty dated. Our room was pretty cold when we arrived so we tried to turn up the heat and the musty burning smell that resulted was so gross I decided to freeze rather than get sick from smelling that. The bathroom, again, even though I mentioned some of it as a positive... The shower head seemed like it was positioned a little lower than it ought to be. I'm 5'5" and the shower head was only up a couple inches higher than me. Someone taller than me could easily hit their head on it if they aren't paying attention, or someone even taller might have to hunch over to wash their face and hair. OVERALL: Would we stay here if we were NOT flying out of Boston and needed parking? No, but if we were then we would with the parking package again. And I'd also recommend it BUT ONLY WITH THE PARKING PACKAGE to anyone who needs 6-10 days of paid parking while they fly as their price is a value (which is the only reason why I gave it 5*'s for value). Otherwise, if you don't need the parking, then I don't see any value in staying here whatsoever. There are better places. Would I recommend this place to tourists driving to Boston? No, it's not close or convenient to anything they would probably plan on visiting, and the tolls once you get into Boston are ridiculous for this area (But hey! That's Taxachusetts for you!). I'm not sure I'd recommend it to tourists flying here either.

Reviews.Title: “Worst Marriott hotel I have stayed at.”
Reviews.Author: guag
Reviews.Content: Negattiv: Not according to Marriott standard. Cooperation between restaurant staff was not in order.Bad smell in corridor and in rooms. Very loud noise from air conditioner. Broken mirror in one room. Positive: Staff in receiption and airport shuttle was very friendly and helpful.

Reviews.Title: “Not really value for buck”
Reviews.Author: defone
Reviews.Content: Really, really basic airport hotel. Only for those who stay short nights for next morning flight. Quite expensive if thinking of venue. Internet connection was really bad and slow.

Reviews.Title: “Not a first choice”
Reviews.Author: ZigmundTsarlip
Reviews.Content: Staffing seems to be an issue at courtyards and this is another example - where the quality of the staff ranges dramatically day to day. After three days they had still failed to move the diet drinks from a back fridge to the main fridge. Front desk staff were more interested in doing paper work than handling customers or seemed to be exceptionally cavalier about how they interacted. The rooms were set up for linking laptop to flat screen for presentation dry runs, similar to wha they have in some of the more advanced courtyards in the Bay area - but they did not have any of the lines - you are expected to bring your own in this facility. One good thing is internet is free - more than I can say for most courtyards. The location, while close to the airport, requires some strangle u-turns and freeway exit ramps. Not straightforward if you are going in multiple directions during your stay. The restaurant is mediocre - though having well meaning staff. The one jewel is that you can take a back road to a small neighborhood that is at the end of one of the Logan runways, separated by freeways and water and cut through by train tracks. It is a little community with a few restaurants and well kept houses and yards, once you get off the main street - great if you like to get out of your room for a walk.

Reviews.Title: “Not bad for a quick stay”
Reviews.Author: GEOFFS3
Reviews.Content: I had a quick stay here on a Thursday night. For a short airport stay, it was perfect. There is really less to say than more. The Location: If you need to be near the airport, this is perfect. It's a 5-minute ride. If you need to be closer to downtown.....well you may not be no hot on the location. To access public transportation, you can ride the hotel shuttle back to the airport and catch the T. The Vibe: This used to be a Holiday Inn until it renovated and re-branded. It doesn't appear or feel like a Courtyard at all......until you are inside. On the outside, you can tell it was a Holiday Inn. The Room: Pretty much standard Courtyard. The bedding was awesome. Flat panel TV, large desk, and a spot to plug in all your wires. My king room had a small couch and coffee table. Otherwise unremarkable. My Gripe: Some of the old Holiday Inn branding still appears in spots. The location certainly is not fabulous, but this is an airport property. Sum it up: Met my expectations for a courtyard. Would stay here again without a doubt.

Reviews.Title: “Bottom of the heap of Marriott Courtyard Hotels”
Reviews.Author: Eujay
Reviews.Content: Let me start by saying that I am a Marriot Gold Member, I stay at Marriott a lot. The address does not show up on my $800.00 Automobile Navigation system. This hotel looks like Marriott Courtyard on the outside and has a nice lobby but the rooms are more like Holiday Inn/Motel 6. Location is in an industrial part of town. Rooms are oddly shaped. LCD TV but no Pay per view and not a lot of channels. I don't get it. Promises High speed internet but it's Wi-fi and this traveller could not get a good signal and gave up. Space age coffee maker that makes one cup at a time and does not allow you to bre your own coffee. Starbucks is onsite but was closed when I arrived at 4.00 in the afternoon on a Thursday. Average bed. Heating is from a noisy "Motel 6" style heater that will keep you up all night if you leave it on, or you can just get cold. The door to my room has a problem with the lock. Onsite resturaunt/bar serves reasonable food at a high price, there is nothing else nearby and no sign of any information on local takeout taxi/other takeout in the room. I stayed there for one night on the last day of a trip to Boston. I just wanted to be near the airport but wish I had chosen a different hotel. Once was enough for me I will never stay there again.

Reviews.Title: “Loved The New Hotel...Very Beautiful Job”
Reviews.Author: GROTTA
Reviews.Content: nice hotel very beautiful lobby and nice lounge.....wifi and coffee in lobby...

HotelInfo.Name: Courtyard by Marriott Boston Logan Airport
HotelInfo.Address: 225 William F. McClellan Highway, Boston, MA 02128
